text: re: closure actions... I see they don't stopPropagation/preventDefault by default, which makes them annoying to use in some contexts.
For example: `<form onsubmit={{action 'save'}}>`. I have to make an effort to capture the event and `preventDefault` it on the action handler.
On the other hand, I have seen in the past advice to prefer closure actions over "classic" ones.
So what is recommended here? Should I use them as I see more appropriate on each case, or should I actually prefer closure actions?
yeah that is an important gotcha
The few times I’ve come across this I’ve opted to use `{{action “save” on=“submit”}}` to get the `preventDefault` "for free"
does seem a shame to have both forms though ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
yeah
I just noticed the guides only mention the classic style (unless I missed something)
so I’m going to continue using classic where it saves me that step
thanks
yeah — I don’t think anyone’s suggesting `{{action}}` will be removed
you have two styles for maximum flexibility
though I think mixonic and mmun would really like us to have `<div {{add-event-listener “click” “myAction”}}>`
or even `<div {{on "click" "myAction"}}>`
